item.title: Changes to Queensland's political donation laws could increase corruption risks, experts say
item.description: A ban on political donations by developers, introduced by the former Qld Labor Government, will be lifted by the LNP.

item.title: Broken Hill community fundraises for mental health in wake of tragic loss
item.description: Alice Wilkinson loved music and was the life of the party. Her death has prompted her family to help others who might be struggling.

item.title: Australia's social media ban reminds us of the power of a loving boundary
item.description: This is where we parents should remind ourselves of the power of the loving boundary: not to bind and constrain, but to properly demonstrate that we hold our kids and their safety in our mind.

item.description: Raised on Pokemon GO, generation Z is finding the hobby of birding just the ticket.

item.title: Matcha's popularity a boon for Japanese farmers but counterfeits a problem
item.description: As Japanese matcha producers struggle with the surge in demand, the industry is facing another problem — counterfeit matcha.

item.title: Grassroots First Nations organisation flags concern for at-risk youth under social media ban
item.description: Social media can help at-risk youth connect with support services, so what impact will the federal government's under-16s ban have on those community hubs?

item.description: The money being spent on drilling for gold has increased 45 per cent in the past 12 months.

item.title: Migrant workers raise concerns at modern slavery inquiry in Coffs Harbour
item.description: Witnesses have told an inquiry into modern slavery that migrant workers are being exploited in the nation's blueberry capital.

item.title: Underwater microphone records humpback whale sounds off NSW south coast
item.description: Underwater microphones off the NSW south coast capture consistent humpback whale sounds throughout the 2024 migration season.

item.title: Melbourne lawyer Dean Hadjina sentenced to prison for stealing from grieving widow
item.description: Dean Hadjina is sentenced to prison for stealing $482,154 from a vulnerable widow who spoke little English as she sought compensation payouts after her husband's workplace death.

item.title: 18-year-old man in critical condition after Gold Coast assault
item.description: An 18-year-old man is in hospital in a critical condition after being assaulted on the Gold Coast on Friday night.

item.title: Croc wrangler Matt Wright's prison sentence a stark warning after years-long court saga
item.description: Crocodile wrangler Matt Wright built a television and tourism empire in the Northern Territory, but that's all come crashing down.

item.title: Federal police release nine images to help identify online child sex abuse victims
item.description: These photographs might look like everyday objects, but the AFP-led Australian Centre to Counter Child Exploitation (ACCCE) believe they could help identify victims of online child sexual exploitation.

item.title: Perth's queer nightclub, Connections, celebrates 50 years of dancing and difference
item.description: Founded in 1975, when homosexuality was still illegal in Western Australia, Connections nightclub has seen waves of social change and kept the party going.

item.title: Google to build undersea cables in Papua New Guinea under Australia defence treaty
item.description: PNG says the measure will provide a key upgrade to its digital backbone and link the north and south of the nation with high-capacity cables.

item.title: Government-formed agency recommends against NSW coal industry expansion
item.description: Coal mining extensions and expansions will continue, the New South Wales premier says, despite a government-appointed agency finding further approvals were not consistent with emissions targets.

item.title: Australian fans among most active in searching for FIFA World Cup tickets
item.description: Australia are among the countries with the most ticket requests for next year's World Cup, which is bound to please Socceroos coach Tony Popovic and his team.

item.title: What you should know about 'Bali belly' and how to avoid it before it ruins your holiday
item.description: Every year about 1.5 million Australians travel to Bali. Chances are either you or someone you know has caught a stomach bug after travelling to the popular Indonesian destination. So what can you do to avoid it?

item.title: Desert Fireball Network students find fist-sized meteorite in outback WA
item.description: PhD students from Curtin University have found a 300-gram meteorite after a five-day search in remote bushland.

item.title: United Nations delegation warns of Australia's treatment of prisoners, detainees and breach in human rights
item.description: A delegation of United Nations inspectors have raised the alarm about Australia's detention facilities and a breach of human rights.

item.description: Perth is in the grip of its hottest spell so far this summer, forcing the closure of a popular tourist attraction as abalone fishing season got underway.

item.description: Aung San Suu Kyi's son leads a rally of supporters in Sydney as part of global demonstrations trying to increase international pressure on Myanmar's ruling military junta.

item.title: Roger Rasheed slams 'battle of the sexes' tennis clash between Nick Kyrgios and Aryna Sabalenka
item.description: High-profile Australian tennis coach Roger Rasheed has questioned the value of the upcoming "battle of the sexes"-style exhibition match between Nick Kyrgios and Aryna Sabalenka.

item.description: Manila's coastguard says nearly two dozen Philippine fishing boats near Sabina Shoal were targeted with water cannon and blocking manoeuvres on Friday.

item.description: Australia batter Usman Khawaja is feeling 100 per cent fit and is open to a return to the middle order for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.description: Your track record doesn't leave me hopeful.

item.title: 'I was tricked': African athlete lured to Russia for work, ends up on front lines of Ukraine war
item.description: Vladimir Putin says Russia has "no need" to recruit foreign fighters to bolster its invasion of Ukraine, but inside this prisoner of war camp, people have a very different story.

item.description: Tensions between the US and Venezuela are soaring after American forces seized an oil tanker in the Caribbean Sea. So why is US President Donald Trump targeting so-called "shadow fleets"?

item.title: How Benjamin Netanyahu's corruption trial became a struggle for Israel itself
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's backers view his corruption trial as a witch hunt — but his detractors argue it is the system finally catching up to a ruthless political operative who is prepared to do anything to hold on to power.

item.title: Two US troops killed in Syria ambush along with one American civilian
item.description: Two US service members and one American civilian are killed in an ambush in central Syria.

item.description: It has been a busy year for search and rescue operations in the Tasmanian high country. Authorities say a concerning number of visitors to the state's famous national parks are ill-prepared for the fickle weather — even during summer.

item.title: Iron deficiency is a challenge for many female athletes, like Super Netball's Zara Walters
item.description: Zara Walters felt tired, dizzy and unable to recover from training sessions — then she found out she was low in iron. It's a condition that often goes undiagnosed, especially in female athletes.

item.title: Gippsland teenager Ethan Monck celebrates first job after a lifetime battling cancer
item.description: Ethan Monck's health problems began the day he was born. Now aged 17, he's celebrating after starting his first job and the freedom it gives him to pursue his hobbies.

item.title: Earthquake due 'in foreseeable future' after 70 years of Adelaide tremors
item.description: Adelaide sits on the most active seismic zone in Australia and has more than its fair share of tremors below magnitude-4, but it's been 71 years since it was rocked by a serious earthquake. Now, it's a matter of when, not if, it gets another one.

item.title: The Kaurna cultural program inspiring students in Adelaide's south
item.description: Kanyanyapilla means "place of many eagles", and it's where Indigenous students in Adelaide are coming to connect with Kaurna culture.

item.description: Sydney Sweeney changed a lot about herself to play Christy Martin in a biopic about the boxer. She says it was a role she had to take.

item.description: Indian football fans ripped up seats and invaded the pitch in Kolkata as Lionel Messi's first appearance in India took a chaotic and dangerous turn.

item.title: Medical groups push for consequences for freebirth 'birthkeepers' posing as medical professionals
item.description: A number of recent deaths linked to freebirths — where a pregnant woman chooses to give birth with no registered medical professional present — is prompting health groups to speak out about rising levels of misinformation.

item.title: Alpha Bakery making famous pies again with family support after dementia diagnosis
item.description: Christopher Tilse has worked from dawn to dusk in a bakery most of his life. Dementia made that a challenge, but thanks to family support, he is still baking.

item.description: It's called the 'bush capital', but three quarters of Canberra's suburbs have recorded a decline in tree coverage.

item.description: The vision shows the moment a gunman sprayed an underworld associate's home with up to 30 rounds while two women and a child were inside.

item.description: As the country heads into the summer holidays, experts are again warning Australians to be aware of swim safety at beaches, pools and other waterways.

item.title: Anthony Albanese condemns Bondi Beach terror attack as 'act of evil antisemitism'
item.description: Anthony Albanese condemns the Bondi beach terror attack as an "act of evil antisemitism" targeting Australia's Jewish community, declaring the nation will never submit to "division, violence or hatred".

item.description: A 10-year-old girl named Matilda has been identified as one of the victims of Sunday's terror attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach.

item.description: Nick Reiner is being held in custody in the US according to the Los Angeles Sheriff's Department.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting live updates: Police promise 'highly visible, precise and around the clock' investigation
item.description: Bondi Beach will remain a crime scene, with security around Sydney's eastern suburbs bolstered. Follow live.

item.title: US officials say Ukraine would get NATO-style guarantees in American peace deal
item.description: Marathon talks between the US and Ukraine could see NATO-like security guarantees extended to Kyiv under a peace deal.

item.title: After being run over by a car while sunbaking, Sam reunites with paramedics who saved her
item.description: Melbourne woman Samantha Hind was sunbaking on her lawn when her husband ran over her. After recovering from the brink of death, she is reunited with the paramedics who saved her life.

item.title: Tasmanian parliament passes new sentencing laws, leading to stronger punishments for hate crimes
item.description: New laws to protect people from targeted violence have sailed through Tasmania's parliament, with experts celebrating their "innovative" approach. But some say the job is not done yet, with work still needed to implement them successfully.

item.title: It's author Jane Austen's 250th birthday, and her books still have lessons for us today
item.description: Her books like Pride and Prejudice and Emma were written hundreds of years ago, but have themes that still resonate in today's society.

item.title: ABC timeline quiz: Guess what came first
item.description: Guess the correct order or events to nail our new timeline quiz, where not all questions are created equal.

item.title: Bondi Beach terrorist attack: How two men unleashed horror on a celebration of joy and light
item.description: From Western Sydney, a father and son made the journey east and brought terror to Bondi Beach and to Sydney's Jewish community.

item.title: What Australia can learn from the great Kiwi interest rate hike experiment
item.description: The RBA's interest rate-cutting cycle is at an end, and now a hardcore handful of critics say they shouldn't have cut rates in the first place. Conveniently, you only need to look across the ditch to see what could've happened if we'd followed that path.

item.title: Bondi attack caused by 'cascading hate' left unchecked, say critics urging antisemitism plan be adopted
item.description: A report that has sat on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's desk for months is being raised by critics as key evidence that the federal government has done too little, too late to respond to the rising tide of antisemitism since the October 7 terror attack in Israel.

item.title: Bondi community members return to site of horrific shooting to offer support, comfort
item.description: On their own, with their dogs, in groups big and small, Bondi residents gathered calmly on Monday near the place where chaos erupted the night before.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting: Community pays tribute to terror victims
item.description: An act of terror took the lives of 15 people at Bondi. Their names, stories and legacies are held close by a shaken, grieving community.

item.title: New Year's Eve bomb plot in California foiled, US authorities say
item.description: US authorities say a New Year's Eve terror plot to bomb five sites in California and attack immigration agents has been thwarted.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting inquiry flagged as victims mourned and injured fight for life
item.description: As sunset unfolded on Monday evening, mourners turned out at sites across Sydney to lay floral tributes for the victims of the Bondi Beach shooting, with the Opera House sails lit up in support of the Jewish community.

item.title: Magic mushroom warning as Nimbin farmer fed up with trespassing foragers
item.description: A farmer is concerned for the safety of people foraging for magic mushrooms, which he has sprayed with herbicide, as a toxicologist warns about the dangers of fungi.

item.title: Outpouring of grief as vigils are held across the UK for Bondi victims
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Christmas Day weather forecast points to heatwave, tropical storms and festive sunshine
item.description: With only nine more sleeps until Christmas, we have now entered the meteorological window of predictability — in other words, forecasts are more accurate than just guessing the weather.

item.title: Inquest into Sonya Dutton's death in outback NSW hears of 'many unanswered questions'
item.description: Barkindji mother-of-two Sonya Dutton, 31, was found in her family's Wilcannia residence on March 29, 2022 — four days after she was reportedly last seen.

item.title: Live markets updates: ASX wilts as sentiment turns against miners and banks
item.description: The ASX has slipped into the red after a positive start to the session. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting gunman Naveed Akram was follower of pro-Islamic State preacher Wisam Haddad
item.description: At least one of the gunmen who killed 15 people in Sunday's Bondi Beach terrorist attack was known to authorities as a follower of a notorious Sydney pro-Islamic State cleric, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Richmond takes Olivia Wolmarans with top pick in the 2025 AFLW draft, Suns complete raid
item.description: Richmond takes Olivia Wolmarans with the top pick in the AFLW draft, as the Suns complete a stunning raid.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Darwin filmmaking program gives storytellers with disabilities a platform
item.description: Aspiring Darwin filmmakers with disabilities have been getting job-ready, developing skills in scriptwriting, directing, cinematography and editing. It's the first time the program has been offered in the NT, with plans for it to expand even further.

item.title: Four killed in Muckatah mini-van crash may have been farm workers, police say
item.description: Four adult passengers in a van, who are yet to be formally identified, died at the scene, north of Shepparton in Victoria. Five injured people, including three children and the male driver, were taken to various hospitals.

item.title: Manhunt for Brown University shooter renewed after police release detained man
item.description: With police releasing a person of interest, the manhunt continues for the Brown University shooter who killed two students and injured nine others.

item.title: Darts player Cameron Menzies apologises after punching a table following world championship loss
item.description: A Scottish darts player has apologised to fans after he punched a table during a loss at the world championship.

item.title: Man killed, two taken to hospital after unit fire in Brisbane suburb of Spring Hill
item.description: Emergency services rushed to a Water Street address in Spring Hill after 3am following reports one of the units in the complex was fully engulfed by flames.

item.title: Advocates express concerns over ACT government wombat management plan
item.description: The ACT government is considering how to better manage the territory's wombat population, in response to challenges being experienced by farmers.

item.title: Noosa region hit with minor flooding, with isolated storms, rain and cooler temperatures forecast for Queensland
item.description: Storms and heavy rain are forecast to again hit large parts of Queensland today, with temperatures dropping across much of the sunshine state.

item.title: London plane trees to be removed in Hamilton following infrastructure concerns
item.description: Twenty-five London plane trees are set to be removed from Hamilton after they were found to be causing problems with local infrastructure.

item.title: NSW cricketer banned from playing after allegations of nude photos being sent to teammates
item.description: A NSW cricketer, who has played at Sheffield Shield level, is banned from playing after allegations he sent nude photos to young teammates.

item.title: Umpires pull Pakistan one-day skipper Shaheen Afridi out of Big Bash attack following full-toss drama
item.description: Umpires in the Big Bash clash between the Renegades and Heat sensationally pull Shaheen Afridi out of the attack after two full-toss deliveries.

item.title: Consent laws now protect sex workers against non-paying clients
item.description: Victims say NSW Police's frontline officers are still catching up with the changed legislation, which makes non-payment for sexual services a criminal offence.

item.title: The Bondi shooter only had a basic gun licence. How could he buy multiple high-powered rifles?
item.description: The Bondi shooter's gun licence entitled him to an uncapped quantity of certain kinds of rifles and shotguns.

item.title: The best board games to play (and gift) this summer
item.description: Over the holiday period, the right game can make all the difference while spending time with friends and family.

item.description: The consumer watchdog is suing home meal delivery providers HelloFresh and Youfoodz for allegedly misleading consumers over subscriptions.

item.title: John Howard calls push to tighten gun laws in wake of Bondi attack an 'attempted diversion'
item.description: Former prime minister John Howard, whose gun reforms fundamentally reshaped Australia, says he would support further tightening, but it cannot be made into a distraction or an "excuse" not to tackle antisemitism.

item.description: Kwang Kyung Yoo murdered a woman and child at a Sydney taekwondo studio before killing the woman's husband at their home.

item.title: Bondi terrorists travelled to Philippines for 'military-style training', security sources say
item.description: Father-son gunmen Sajid and Naveed Akram travelled to the Philippines to receive "military-style training" in the month before they killed 15 people at a Hanukkah celebration at Bondi Beach, security sources have confirmed.

item.title: Anthony Albanese visits Ahmed Al Ahmed as Bondi hero's first video message circulates
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese visits Bondi hero Ahmed Al Ahmed at St George Hospital in Sydney's south.

item.title: Usman Khawaja left out of Adelaide Test as Pat Cummins and Nathan Lyon return to Ashes
item.description: Australian selectors stick with Josh Inglis as Usman Khawaja misses out on selection for the third Test in Adelaide.

item.title: Bywong man pleads guilty to animal cruelty after dragging conscious kangaroo behind car
item.description: A Bywong man pleads guilty in the Queanbeyan Local Court to aggravated animal cruelty after dragging a conscious kangaroo behind his car earlier this year.

item.title: Farmers' Facebook group racks up 100,000 followers as they seek support across seasons
item.description: A group dedicated to Australian grain farming created more than a decade ago has just cracked 100,000 followers with about 20,000 people following from overseas.

item.title: Tributes flow after Australian Paralympic bronze medallist Nicholas Hum dies aged 32
item.description: Australian Paralympic bronze medallist Nicholas Hum is mourned after his shock death aged 32.

item.title: Donald Trump files $US10 billion lawsuit against BBC over documentary edit
item.description: US President Donald Trump has filed a defamation lawsuit against the BBC in Miami federal court, seeking at least $US10 billion ($15.1 billion) in damages.

item.title: Bendigo Writers Festival debacle continues as La Trobe University is asked to apologise
item.description: The debate around the failed Bendigo Writers Festival, which will not run next year, again embroils sponsor La Trobe University in controversy amid calls for more transparency and accountability.

item.title: Children pick $20,000 worth of toys for vulnerable families this Christmas
item.description: A dozen children go on a shopping spree to pick presents for kids their age who otherwise may not have presents under their tree.

item.title: South Australia's Chief Justice Chris Kourakis retires
item.description: After 13 years serving as South Australia's top judge, Chief Justice Chris Kourakis says it is "an appropriate time to retire".

item.title: David Sharaz declared bankrupt in federal court hearing prompted by Linda Reynolds
item.description: Brittany Higgins's husband David Sharaz is declared bankrupt in the federal court, two months after former senator Linda Reynolds served him bankruptcy papers.

item.title: NT police charge man, 27, with murder after partner's 'suspicious' death in Borroloola
item.description: Police have charged a 27-year-old man with his partner's murder after she was found unresponsive in the remote community of Borroloola, south-east of Darwin.

item.title: Small plane crashes in central Mexico, killing at least 7 people

item.title: Flu prompts postponement of A-League Women's match between Reds and City
item.description: An outbreak of the flu has delayed an upcoming A-League Women's match between Adelaide United and Melbourne City, as South Australia grapples with a record number of cases.

item.title: Luke Lights live streams interactive Christmas display from Adelaide foothills
item.description: With the push of a smartphone button, those watching Luke Denton's Christmas light display in Blackwood can add their own splashes of colour, or even turn the whole thing off.

item.title: How music makes Jane Austen’s stories sparkle on the page and on screen
item.description: 250 years after Jane Austen's birth, her love of music lives on in the characters from her books and screen adaptations.

item.title: WA's gun laws in national spotlight with national reforms flagged after Bondi terror attack
item.description: As Australia looks to strengthen its firearms laws in the wake of the Bondi terror attack, recent changes to Western Australia's gun rules could provide a blueprint for the nation.
